intro: Astydamia ifniensis, commonly known as the Ifni astydamia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Astydamia ifniensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
